snippet: Silda Wall Spitzer has so far been all but invisible as her husband, former Gov. Eliot Spitzer, runs for New York City comptroller, a stark contrast from his earlier days in politics.
abstract: Silda Wall Spitzer has so far been all but invisible as her husband, former Gov Eliot Spitzer, runs for New York City comptroller; it is stark contrast from his earlier days in politics, before his career was upended by sex scandal; Spitzer has said the approval of his wife was essential before his attempted political comeback, but she has yet to issue a statement of support or appear at her husband's side.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Janon Fisher, Danny Hakim, Randy Leonard and Mei-Yu Liu.

lead_paragraph: Silda Wall Spitzer has so far been all but invisible as her husband, former Gov. Eliot Spitzer, runs for New York City comptroller, a stark contrast from his earlier days in politics.

headline.main: As Spitzer Pursues a Comeback, His Wife Chooses to Stay Offstage
headline.print_headline: As Spitzer Pursues a Comeback, His Wife Chooses to Stay Offstage
